discussion.content: D - Configure and apply a custom adapter policy

questions.question_text: The OS team has requested that you expand the receive queues of an existing server. Which action accomplishes this change?

choices.A: Configure and apply a custom LAN connectivity policy.
choices.C: Reconfigure the vNIC to the requested queue size.
choices.D: Configure and apply a custom adapter policy. C

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. After you upgrade Cisco UCS firmware, some of your blades have these error messages. Which description of the problem is true?

choices.D: Service profile requires a connectivity policy.
choices.A: vNIC template must be converted to updating.
The upstream vFC interface is disabled.
choices.E: The upstream switch port is disabled.
choices.C: The upstream switch is in NPV mode.
choices.D: No interfaces have been configured as uplinks.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which cause of this error is true?

Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

After you deploy a service profile from a template, you
encounter these two errors.
Which action is needed to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
A. Remove the server from maintenance mode. (Not a valid option)
B. Install an operating system. (Correct Answer: OS drivers are required to bring links up. This is the common issue that causes fault code F0283)
C. Reassociate the service profile. (This does not change the state if the profile is the same. Status is state not configuration)
D. Reset the server in the server General subtab. (Power state is unknown. Correct option would provide the current state)
E. Associate a vNIC template to the service profile template. (A vNIC template optional and is not required for a service profile. Current information does not provide enough information to idenify if one is in use.)
MasterDebug, agreed, I don't know which is correct but don't see why it is OS related. VIF would be vNIC, which goes with link-down and the only one is D related to vNIC. still not clear though!
thx, but I still do not see the point with installing an OS.

fltDcxVcDown
Fault Code:F0283
Message
[transport] VIF [chassisId] / [slotId] [switchId]-[id] down, reason: [stateQual][transport] VIF [chassisId]
/ [id] [switchId]-[id] down, reason: [stateQual]
Explanation
The transport VIF for server is down.The Cisco UCS Manager raises this fault when any of the following
scenario occur:
• Endpoint(switch/fabric interconnect) reports the connectivity state on virtual interface as one of:
a.down, b.errored, c.unavailable.
Recommended Action
If you see this fault, take the following actions:
Step 1 If the fault occurs in the Cisco UCS Manager GUI, capture one or more screenshots of the fault message
and other related areas.
Step 2 Verify that the blade discovery was completed successfully. Check the states on all of the communicating
ports in an end to end manner.
Step 3 If connectivity seems correct, recommision the server.
Step 4 Execute the show tech-support command and contact Cisco Technical Support.
Any doc reference for this answer ?

choices.A: Remove the server from maintenance mode.
choices.E: Associate a vNIC template to the service profile template.
choices.D: Reset the server in the server General subtab.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

SwitchA and switchB have these zonesets currently active and are connected by an ISL that is configured to transport VSAN 2. Enhanced zoning is configured for
VSAN 2, and merge-control is set to restrict.
Which statement about this configuration is true?

discussion.content:
C is correct:
Merging the Database
The merge behavior depends on the fabric-wide merge control setting:
Restrict—If the two databases are not identical, the ISLs between the switches are isolated.
Allow—The two databases are merged using the merge rules specified in the Table 1.

Since the fabric is set to restrict on switch 2 and the zones are not identical is will fail.

choices.C: Zone merge fails because the currently active zone sets are not identical.
choices.D: Zone merge succeeds and the resulting zone set matches switchB.
choices.E: Enhanced zoning is configured, so the user is prompted on the CLI to permit or deny Zone2 into the active zone set. B
choices.A: Zone merge fails because merge-control set to restrict, which means that merges are never permitted.
choices.B: Zone merge succeeds but Zone2 is dropped from the active zone set because it is not currently included in the active zone set in switchA.
